summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report and Lieutenant's Log for August 9, 2019. It details routine prison operations, inmate counts, staff assignments, and security procedures. The log notes several inmates on suicide watch, a dry cell placement, and a canceled treaty transfer flight due to mechanical problems. It is significant as it documents the operational environment of the MCC just hours before Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.

connections.description: The lieutenants (shift supervisors) report up the chain of command to the Warden, as indicated by the report being addressed to the Warden.
The lieutenants report to the Associate Warden for Operations, a direct supervisory line.

events.title: Treaty Transfer Flight Canceled
events.description: A treaty transfer return flight was canceled due to mechanical problems, as noted in the Morning Watch shift report.

events.title: Inmate Placed on Dry Cell
events.description: An inmate (I/M) was placed on a dry cell in the R&D holding cell with staff watch during the Day Watch shift.

events.title: Multiple Inmates on Suicide Watch
events.description: The log repeatedly notes inmates on suicide watch, some with inmate companions, throughout all three shifts (Morning, Day, Evening).

events.title: Inmate Placed in Administrative Detention
events.description: An inmate with registration number 331 from unit KN was placed in Administrative Detention at 8:28 PM for "Introduction of tobacco."

events.title: Institutional Lockdown for Count
events.description: The institution was locked down at 3:45 PM during the Day Watch shift to conduct an inmate count.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: This log details prison operations on August 9, 2019, the day before Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the MCC.

The report indicates multiple systemic issues: a malfunctioning Control Center Fire Panel, a malfunctioning public address system preventing PREA announcements, and chronic staff shortages leading to vacated correctional assignments.
Several inmates were on suicide watch with inmate companions, and one inmate was placed in a dry cell under staff watch.
A treaty transfer flight for an inmate was canceled due to mechanical problems.
The log shows routine security procedures were being followed, including body alarm tests, metal detector checks, roof checks, and multiple inmate counts throughout the day.
